title: Senior Software Engineer 1
description:
**Who are we?**
 At Celigo, we are pioneering the future of application integration with novel new strategies, cutting edge technologies, and of course a diehard team that will go to any length to make your most complicated integrations just work. Our core mission at Celigo is simple: to enable independent best of breed applications to work together as one. We believe that every independent department and every business end user should always have choices when it comes to picking software, and that integration challenges should never stand in the way.
   

  

**Location \\-** 
 Hyderabad, India.
   

  

**Your Role**
 Join a team of highly talented individuals committed to offering the best quality services and products in the area of business cloud computing (SaaS). In this position, you will design and develop backend features for the integrator.io platform using cutting edge technologies that will allow integrations between business apps for users of cloud systems such as NetSuite, Salesforce.com, Google, Amazon, Magento, and more.
   

  

**Required Experience**
 We are looking for someone that absolutely loves to write code. Experience with JavaScript and Node JS is a huge plus, but if there are any really talented developers out there looking to try something new, we would love to hear from you too!
   

  

**All Candidates Applying Should Have**
* 4\\-7 years of experience in a relevant field (from only product based companies)
* Solid foundation in computer science with strong competency in
* Data structures
* Design principles
* Algorithms
* Software design
* Some familiarity with the following applications is a plus point:
* Node JS
* MongoDB
* Amazon AWS
* Apache Kafka


**Required Skills**
 All candidates applying must have the following characteristics:
   

  

* Exceptional problem solver ‚Äì able to design sound (and simple whenever possible) solutions to complex problems, including the ability to work from scratch
* Fast learner ‚Äì ability to step in and develop working knowledge of a technology in a less than average amount of time
* Self\\-starter ‚Äì motivation, work ethic and ambition to distinguish one‚Äôs self are key
* Genuine Interest in Technology ‚Äì desire to be on the cutting edge of cloud\\-based technologies.
* Enjoy the start\\-up atmosphere and are flexible with shifting priorities.
* Think big and bring new ideas to the table‚Äîregardless of rank or title.
* Bring ambition, a proactive mindset and the ability to inspire others.
* Strive for results‚Äîalways.
* Learn quickly. Must know when to listen, and when to take charge.

title: Software Engineer II
description:
**About Blackhawk Network:**
 Today, through BHN‚Äôs single global platform, businesses of all kinds can tap into the world‚Äôs largest network of branded payment solutions. BHN helps businesses grow revenue, increase loyalty, motivate and reward their teams, disburse funds and engage consumers. Branded payment solutions include the issuance and distribution of gift cards, egifts, corporate payouts and rewards, along with the technology to deliver these products in seamless, integrated ways. BHN‚Äôs network spans the globe with more than 400,000 consumer touchpoints. Learn more at BHN.com.
   

  

**Overview:**
 If you enjoy building world class payment applications, are highly passionate about pushing the boundaries of scale and availability on the cloud, leveraging the next horizon technologies, rapidly deliver features to production, make data driven decisions on product development, collaborate and innovate with like\\-minded experts, then this would be your ideal job. Blackhawk is seeking passionate backend engineers at all levels to build our next generation of payment systems on a public cloud infrastructure. Our team enjoys working together to contribute to meaningful work seen by millions of merchants worldwide.
   

  

 You will build different parts of our payment network, that have high scale, precision and availability requirements. You will be part of a world class team delivering awesome features to Blackhawk consumers and partners. You will stretch the limits of backend technologies to deliver functionality. You will be constantly leveraging cutting edge technologies on the cloud, and application stacks to build efficient systems. You will be an awesome team player that can learn and coach simultaneously. You will learn to innovate. You will build relationships with the world's best payments systems while you help them realize their visions. Your work will play an essential part in how developers build state of the art payment experiences that consumers love.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Preferred Skills
* AWS Certifications, such as:
+ AWS Certified DevOps Engineer ‚Äì Professional
+ Solutions Architect ‚Äì Associate/Professional
+ SysOps Administrator

* Some experience working with Java\\-based applications
* Experience with event\\-driven architectures using:
+ SNS, SQS, Lambda, Step Functions
+ Exposure to cost optimization strategies and billing analysis in AWS
+ Experience with Java build tools and dependency managers (e.g., Maven, Gradle)
+ Experience with blue/green or canary deployment strategies
+ Building and maintaining Java\\-based microservices and RESTful APIs
+ Proficiency with Java frameworks such as Spring Boot or Micronaut
+ Experience with Java build tools and dependency managers (e.g., Maven, Gradle)
+ Familiarity with object\\-oriented design principles and design patterns

* Soft Skills
+ Strong problem\\-solving skills and a proactive mindset
+ Excellent communication and collaboration skills
+ Ability to thrive in a fast\\-paced, agile environment
+ Commitment to automation, documentation, and continuous improvement


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer information systems, Computer Science, or a related field
* 2\\+ years of hands\\-on experience in a DevOps, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), or Systems Engineering role
* Proficient in scripting languages such as Python and Bash
* Strong experience with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions)
* Experience in translating business requirements into functional, deployable, and maintainable application modules using tools like BitBucket, Jenkins, Artifactory, and AWS
* Hands\\-on experience with AWS cloud platforms
* Knowledge of web servers and application frameworks such as Apache and Tomcat
* Experience with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes
* Solid understanding of Linux system administration, networking, and cloud security best practices
* Experience with monitoring and logging tools (e.g., CloudWatch, X\\-Ray, AWS Config, New Relic)
* Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git


 We seek candidates who not only demonstrate curiosity and adaptability in emerging technologies but have also successfully implemented and utilized AI tools to enhance their work, improve processes, or deliver measurable results. Our teams embrace continuous learning and the thoughtful integration of AI to create meaningful impact ‚Äì for our employees and the future of work.

title: AI Test Engineer
description:
**Title: AI Test Engineer**
**Astellas‚Äô Global Capability Centers ‚Äì Overview**
 Astellas‚Äô Global Capability Centers (GCCs) are strategically located sites that give Astellas the ability to access talent across various functions in the value chain and to co\\-locate core capabilities that are currently dispersed. Our three GCCs are in India, Poland and Mexico.
   

  

 The GCCs will enhance our operational efficiency, resilience and innovation potential, enabling a timely response to changing business demands.
   

  

 Our GCCs are an integral part of Astellas, guided by our shared values and behaviors, and are critical enablers of the company‚Äôs strategic priorities, sustainable growth, and commitment to turn innovative science into VALUE for patients.
   

  

**Purpose And Scope**
 This Gen AI Release Engineer position is dedicated to a priority program within Astellas, called the Gen AI POD. The Gen AI POD is responsible for evaluating, implementing, maintaining, and owning enterprise level Gen AI tools, both internal built products and licensed vendor products.
   

  

 As a Gen AI Release Engineer, you will be a crucial player in driving our digital initiatives forward in our agile organization. Our agile operating model consists of two components ‚Äì Digital Capability and Digital Execution. Digital Execution is about aligning multiple missions around business goals and facilitating collaboration on a larger scale. Digital Capability, on the other hand, focuses on the growth and development of individuals within a specific expertise area. This dual structure enables us to scale agile practices efficiently while maintaining a focus on both product development and individual skill enhancement.
   

  

 As a Gen AI Release Engineer, you ensure initiatives for Agentic AI and Gen AI products are fit for purpose and meet user/business requirements. This role involves a blend of technical expertise, business acumen, and understanding of current Agentic AI trends, capabilities, and limitations. You will ensure smooth and reliable deployment of agentic AI solutions and related configurations. You will use your knowledge, expertise, and quick learning to stay ahead and ensure value is delivered with high quality. This position bridges development, QA, and operations, focusing on automation, governance, and compliance for AI\\-driven workflows. The evolving use and future opportunities bring a lot of variety to your day\\-to\\-day job.
   

  

**This position is based in Bengaluru and will require some on\\-site work** 
**\\_.\\_**
**Responsibilities And Accountabilities**
* Release Management for Gen AI Solutions: Coordinate and execute releases for AI agents, low\\-code workflows, and DigitalX platforms.
* Agent Configuration \\& Governance: Manage versioning and configuration of AI agents, ensuring alignment with standards and compliance frameworks.
* Testing \\& Quality Assurance: Collaborate with POD teams to validate AI agent behavior, performance, and integration before release.
* Documentation \\& Knowledge Sharing: Maintain detailed release notes, rollback strategies, and contribute to playbooks for Gen AI adoption.
* Cross\\-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Gen AI Analysts, AI Solutions Engineers, and DigitalX stakeholders to support innovation and operational excellence.


**Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field.
* 3\\+ years in release engineering in AI/ML environments.
* 3\\+ years‚Äô experience writing and executing test scripts, preferably testing AI products.
* Experience with testing tools like ALM, Tosca, Selenium, etc.
* Experience with agentic AI frameworks and low\\-code platforms.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Life Sciences / Pharma industry/Digital Health experience
* Agile experience
* Certifications in cloud (Azure/AWS) or AI governance are a plus.


 "Beware of recruitment scams impersonating Astellas recruiters or representatives. Authentic communication will only originate from an official Astellas LinkedIn profile or a verified company email address. If you encounter a fake profile or anything suspicious, report it promptly to LinkedIn's support team through LinkedIn Help‚Äù
   

  

 Category EnablementX
   

  

 Astellas is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment.
   

  

 EOE including Disability/Protected Veterans

title: Junior QA Engineer
description:
**About the Role** 





 Ensure quality, reliability, and usability of TourIQ, a B2B AI\\-powered SaaS platform. Validate functionality across APIs, dashboards, data pipelines, and business workflows. Starts with manual \\+ API testing with a clear path to automated test suites by Month 3\\. We teach automation.
 




  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  





**Functional \\& UI Testing** 



* Manual test all dashboard views and user workflows end\\-to\\-end
* Test onboarding flows, notifications, and responsive design across devices



  





**API \\& Data Testing** 



* Test API endpoints with Postman; validate data sync accuracy and error recovery
* SQL queries for data validation in PostgreSQL



  





**Security \\& Access Control** 



* Test multi\\-tenant data isolation; validate role\\-based access controls
* Validate authentication flows: login, MFA, password reset, session management



  





**AI Feature Validation** 



* Validate AI\\-generated outputs display correctly and behave within expected boundaries



  





**Automation Ramp\\-Up (Month 3\\+)** 



* Begin building automated API test suites for critical paths; build regression suites



  





**Process** 



* Test cases, test data, bug reports with clear reproduction steps; release testing; collaboration with devs/designers



  





**Must\\-Have** 



* \\~1 year in QA / software testing; strong manual testing fundamentals
* Basic API testing (Postman or similar); clear test cases and bug reports
* Understanding of SDLC and QA processes; attention to detail



  





**Good to Have** 



* B2B/dashboard applications; SQL; automation awareness (Selenium, Cypress, pytest ‚Äî we teach); responsive web testing; Git



  





**Mindset** 





 Detail\\-oriented. Tests edge cases others miss. Clear communicator. Eager to learn automation.
 




  





**Why Join** 





 QA on a real production product. We actively teach automation. Growth path: Junior QA ‚Üí QA Engineer ‚Üí Automation QA. Onsite in Jaipur.

title: System Reliability Engineer
description:
**What You Can Expect**
 As an SRE, you can anticipate opportunities to work on our hybrid systems across the globe. You will be responsible for installing, configuring, and monitoring new systems within a network of global data centers. Additionally, you will patch and maintain thousands of physical and cloud systems worldwide. To streamline operations, you will develop automation to reduce repetitive tasks and analyze and address performance bottlenecks. Furthermore, you will update and troubleshoot user access permissions, resolve network connectivity issues, and maintain system firewalls.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Zoom's SRE team is committed to delivering customer happiness, improving business efficiency, and promoting agility through innovation, data\\-driven insights, and automation. Our impact is reflected in smooth user experiences, optimized processes, and support for Zoom's expansion in the realm of communication and collaboration.
   

  

**What We‚Äôre Looking For**
* Hold BS/MS in Computer Science or related field. (CS or related major as preference) and bring 2\\-5 years of hands\\-on experience in Site Reliability Engineering, DevOps, or Production Operations roles.
* Demonstrate proficiency in scripting languages including Python and Shell.
* Possess expertise of Linux systems administration with a focus on Ubuntu.
* Participate in on\\-call shifts and incident management and work after hours/weekends for infra change/deployment.
* Apply analytical and troubleshooting skills to diagnose complex system issues.
* Utilize CI/CD pipelines (e.g. Jenkins, GitLab CI) and version control systems (e.g. Git).
* Implement build automation, configuration management tools (e.g. Ansible), and IaC provisioning tools (e.g. Packer/Terraform).
* Manage bare metal infrastructure and datacenter operations, including proficiency in operating system deployment tools (Foreman, Cobbler, MAAS etc.).
* Navigate through diverse cloud platforms.
* Leverage Kubernetes experience or Linux certification (sought after but not required).


**Ways of Working**
 Our structured hybrid approach is centered around our offices and remote work environments. The work style of each role, Hybrid, Remote, or In\\-Person is indicated in the job description/posting.
   

  

**Benefits**
 As part of our award\\-winning workplace culture and commitment to delivering happiness, our benefits program offers a variety of perks, benefits, and options to help employees maintain their physical, mental, emotional, and financial health; support work\\-life balance; and contribute to their community in meaningful ways. Click Learn for more information.
   

  

**About Us**
 Zoomies help people stay connected so they can get more done together. We set out to build the best collaboration platform for the enterprise, and today help people communicate better with products like Zoom Contact Center, Zoom Phone, Zoom Events, Zoom Apps, Zoom Rooms, and Zoom Webinars.
   

  

 We‚Äôre problem\\-solvers, working at a fast pace to design solutions with our customers and users in mind. Find room to grow with opportunities to stretch your skills and advance your career in a collaborative, growth\\-focused environment.
   

  

**Our Commitment**
 At Zoom, we believe great work happens when people feel supported and empowered. We‚Äôre committed to fair hiring practices that ensure every candidate is evaluated based on skills, experience, and potential. If you require an accommodation during the hiring process, let us know‚Äîwe‚Äôre here to support you at every step.
   

  

 If you need assistance navigating the interview process due to a medical disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon. This form is solely for applicants who require an accommodation due to a qualifying medical disability. Non\\-accommodation\\-related requests, such as application follow\\-ups or technical issues, will not be addressed.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Founding Software Engineer (Distributed Systems)** 




**Location:** 
 Bangalore, India (On\\-site/Hybrid)
 



**Type:** 
 Full\\-time
 



**About XHawk.ai** 




 XHawk.ai is building the
 **System of Context** 
 for the next generation of software engineering. We believe the future of development is hybrid‚Äîwhere humans and coding agents work side\\-by\\-step. To make this reality, we are building an AI\\-native, headless platform that serves as the backend store and intelligence layer for engineering teams.
 



  





 We are a seed\\-stage startup moving fast to define how context for SDLC is managed in an LLM\\-first world. If you are obsessed with developer tools, coding workflows, and building systems that "understand" code better than a human, this is your ground floor.
 



  





**The Role** 




 As a Founding Engineer, you will work directly with the early team to architect and build the core engine of XHawk.
 



  





**What you‚Äôll do:** 



* **Build the "Brain":** 
 Architect and implement the backend intelligence layer that powers our "System of Context."
* **Scale the Data Layer:** 
 Build high\\-performance context stores that can ingest, index, and retrieve massive amounts of engineering data (code, docs, runtime systems) in real\\-time.



**Who You Are** 



* **Polyglot \\& Versatile:** 
 You are comfortable moving between languages (Python, Go and Typescript) and cloud stacks. You pick the right tool for the job.
* **AI\\-Native Builder:** 
 You have hands\\-on experience building with LLMs (OpenAI, Anthropic, OpenCode, Gemini, etc) and understand the challenges of context windows and agentic loops.
* **Systems Thinker:** 
 You understand how to build "headless" platforms and APIs that other developers love to use.
* **Massive Scale** 
 : You understand what it takes to build systems that can run across 100's of nodes and handle millions of API calls every day
* **High Ownership:** 
 You thrive in an early\\-stage, zero\\-to\\-one environment. You don't wait for a ticket; you see a problem and solve it.



  





**Bonus Points** 



* You prefer to use Claude Code over IDE and are comfortable pushing to master branch every day
* Familiarity with vector databases and semantic search
* Previous experience in a fast pace startup



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* **Define the Category:** 
 We aren't just building a tool; we are defining how AI agents and humans collaborate to re\\-invent SDLC
* **Founding Equity:** 
 Significant equity package commensurate with the early team role.
* **Hard Problems:** 
 We are solving complex technical challenges in distributed systems.

title: SW Development Engineer 2 - iOS
description:
**The Company**
 Dexcom Corporation (NASDAQ DXCM) is a pioneer and global leader in continuous glucose monitoring (CGM). Dexcom began as a small company with a big dream: To forever change how diabetes is managed. To unlock information and insights that drive better health outcomes. Here we are 25 years later, having pioneered an industry. And we're just getting started. We are broadening our vision beyond diabetes to empower people to take control of health. That means personalized, actionable insights aimed at solving important health challenges. To continue what we've started: Improving human health.
   

  

 We are driven by thousands of ambitious, passionate people worldwide who are willing to fight like warriors to earn the trust of our customers by listening, serving with integrity, thinking big, and being dependable. We've already changed millions of lives and we're ready to change millions more. Our future ambition is to become a leading consumer health technology company while continuing to develop solutions for serious health conditions. We'll get there by constantly reinventing unique biosensing\\-technology experiences. Though we've come a long way from our small company days, our dreams are bigger than ever. The opportunity to improve health on a global scale stands before us.
   

  

**Meet The Team**
 Join a dynamic and collaborative engineering team at Dexcom, a leader in continuous glucose monitoring (CGM). We're passionate about developing innovative technology that improves the lives of people with diabetes. The (Level) role is crucial to our continued success, developing our apps and solutions to meet the needs of our expanding user population and partner ecosystem. We offer a fast\\-paced, exciting environment where you'll be challenged to push boundaries and make a real difference in the world of healthcare. We value innovation, collaboration, and a results\\-oriented approach.
   

  

**Where You Come In**
* You design and build applications for the iOS platform
* You implement requirements on iOS apps, write and update design documents
* You will continuously discover, evaluate and implement new technologies to strengthen development efficiency
* You interface with software test to ensure high quality product
* You develop automated unit and integration tests
* You participate in design, code and test reviews
* You propose and implement enhancements to the apps to improve sustainability.


**What Makes You Successful**
* You have native iOS app development experience using Swift in combination with both UIKit and SwiftUI. Knowledge of Objective C is preferred.
* You have professional software development experience
* You bring a high degree of diligence in documentation, testing and coding
* You have experience working in Agile teams \\& using tools such as Jira and Confluence
* You have experience using CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Bamboo, Github Actions
* You have experience with version control tools such as Git, Github, Gitlab, Bitbucket and GitFlow
* You have experience writing automated tests using XCTest and XCUITest
* You have working knowledge of design patterns such as MVC, MVVM, MVP


**Education And Experience Requirements**
* Typically requires a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a technical discipline, and a minimum of 2\\-5 years related experience or Master‚Äôs degree and 0\\-2 years equivalent experience.


*To all Staffing and Recruiting Agencies: Our Careers Site is only for individuals seeking a job at Dexcom. Only authorized staffing and recruiting agencies may use this site or to submit profiles, applications or resumes on specific requisitions. Dexcom does not accept unsolicited resumes or applications from agencies. Please do not forward resumes to the Talent Acquisition team, Dexcom employees or any other company location. Dexcom is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/applications.*

title: Sr. QA Engineer
description:
**Real people. Real service.**
 At‚ÄØSupplyHouse.com, we value every individual team member and cultivate a community where people come first. Led by our core values of
 **G** 
 enerosity,
 **R** 
 espect,
 **I** 
 nnovation,
 **T** 
 eamwork, and GRIT, we‚Äôre dedicated to maintaining a supportive work environment that celebrates diversity and empowers everyone to reach their full potential. As an industry\\-leading e\\-commerce company specializing in HVAC, plumbing, heating, and electrical supplies since 2004, we strive to foster growth while providing the best possible experience for our customers.
   

  

 Through an Employer of Record (EOR), we are looking for a new, remote
 **Sr. QA Engineer** 
 in India to join our growing IT Team. This individual will report into our QA Team Lead and work closely with cross\\-functional partners to ensure our software adheres to established quality standards through web and mobile automated testing using
 **Cypress** 
 and
 **Appium** 
 .
 
 If you‚Äôre passionate about making a meaningful impact through software excellence and implementing innovative solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
   

  

**Role Type:** 
 Full\\-Time
   

  

**Location:** 

 Remote from India
   

  

**Schedule:** 
 Monday through Friday, 4:00 a.m. ‚Äì 1:00 p.m. U.S. Eastern Time / 12:00 p.m. ‚Äì 9:00 p.m. Indian Standard Time to ensure effective collaboration
   

  

**Base Salary:** 
 $23,500 ‚Äì $29,500 USD per year
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop, verify, and validate system test cases for web\\-based and mobile applications
* Create and execute test plans, set up test environments, and understand \\+ execute test scripts for database execution
* Validate end\\-to\\-end functionality and enhancement requests
* Resolve technical and business issues using strong analytical, troubleshooting, and debugging skills
* Partner with leadership to implement effective testing solutions
* Build cross\\-functional partnerships and collaborate with Developers, Project Managers, and UX Designers to solve complex challenges to maximize the customer experience
* Serve as a mentor to junior team members
* Maintain current technical knowledge to support rapidly changing technology, constantly looking for modern technologies and working with the team in introducing these technologies


**Requirements:**
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field with 7\\+ years of QA engineering experience or no degree with 5\\+ years of equivalent experience
* 5\\+ years of professional programming experience in Java, JavaScript, and SQL
* 5\\+ years of professional web automation experience utilizing page object modeling (POM) including proficiency with‚ÄØCypress
* Deep understanding of API testing, both automated and manual, for web, backend, and mobile applications using REST/RestAssured and Micro services
* Experience with test automation tools such as MySQL, Postman, and Eclipse IDE
* High\\-level proficiency of written and verbal communication in English


**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Experience working in an e\\-commerce environment
* 2\\+ years of mobile automation experience using Appium, plus WebDriver IO \\+ Mocha \\+ Chai
* Web automation experience with Selenium and Cucumber


**Why work with us:** 
  

  

* We have awesome benefits‚ÄØ‚Äì We offer a wide variety of benefits to help support you and your loved ones. These include:
+ Comprehensive and affordable medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options
+ Competitive Provident Fund contributions
+ Paid casual and sick leave, plus country\\-specific holidays
+ Mental health support and wellbeing program
+ Company\\-provided equipment and one\\-time $250 USD work from home stipend
+ $750 USD annual professional development budget
+ Company rewards and recognition program
+ And more!

* We empower ownership‚ÄØ‚Äì We all contribute to our success and we all share in it. Our Ownership for All program ensures each SupplyHouse team member will benefit financially from the company‚Äôs growth and accomplishments.
* We promote work\\-life balance‚ÄØ‚Äì We value your time and encourage a healthy separation between your professional and personal life to feel refreshed and recharged. Look out for our 100% remote schedule and wellness initiatives!
* We support growth‚ÄØ‚Äì We strive to innovate every day. In an exciting and evolving industry, we provide potential for career growth through our hands\\-on training, access to the latest technologies and tools, diversity and inclusion initiatives, opportunities for internal mobility, and professional development budget.
* We give back‚ÄØ‚Äì We live and breathe our core value, Generosity, by giving back to the trades and organizations around the world. We make a difference through donation drives, employee\\-nominated contributions, support for DE\\&I organizations, and more.
* We listen‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØWe value hearing from our employees. Everyone has a voice, and we encourage you to use it! We actively elicit feedback through our monthly town halls, regular 1:1 check\\-ins, and company\\-wide ideas form to incorporate suggestions and ensure our team enjoys coming to work every day.


**Check us out and learn more at** 

**https://www.supplyhouse.com/our\\-company** 
**!** 
  

  

**Additional Details:** 
  

  

* Remote employees are expected to work in a distraction\\-free environment. Personal devices, background noise, and other distractions should be kept to a minimum to avoid disrupting virtual meetings or business operations.
* SupplyHouse.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer,‚ÄØstrongly values inclusion, and encourages individuals of all backgrounds and experiences to apply for this position.
* To ensure fairness and trust in our hiring process, we ask that all application materials, assessments, and interview responses reflect your own thinking and perspective. You may use AI tools to assist in preparing your responses, as long as this use is clearly disclosed and you can speak authentically to your ideas and work. Our focus is on honesty, judgment, and how you approach problem\\-solving. We appreciate your transparency and look forward to learning more about your skills.
* We are committed to providing a safe and secure work environment and conduct thorough background checks on all potential employees in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
* All emails from the SupplyHouse team will only be sent from an @supplyhouse.com email address. Please exercise caution if you receive an email from an alternate domain.


**What is an Employer of Record (EOR)?**
 Through our partnership with Remote.com, a global Employer of Record (EOR), you can join SupplyHouse from home, while knowing your employment is handled compliantly and securely. Remote takes care of the behind\\-the\\-scenes details ‚Äì like payroll, benefits, taxes, and local compliance ‚Äì so you can focus on your work and career growth. Even though Remote manages these administrative functions, you‚Äôll be a part of the SupplyHouse team: connected to our culture, collaborating with colleagues, and contributing to our shared success. This partnership allows us to welcome talented team members worldwide while ensuring you receive a best\\-in\\-class employee experience.

title: Datascientist-AI
description:
TE\\-4 Years and above
   

  

 NP\\- Immediate\\-15 days

description:
**Position Type**
 Full time
   

  

**Type Of Hire**
 Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
   

  

**Education Desired**
 Bachelor of Computer Engineering
   

  

**Java Developer ‚Äì Payments Domain Specialist (Bangalore)**
 Are you curious, motivated, and forward\\-thinking? At FIS you‚Äôll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.
   

  

**About The Team**
 This role is a part of our
 **OPF ‚Äì Software Engineer Team (Payment Domain).** 
 FIS Open Payment Framework (OPF) is a set of reusable and extensible components, frameworks, and technical services which can be assembled in different configurations to build a personalized Payment Processing System.
   

  

**What You Bring**
* Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Information Systems, or an equivalent combination of education, training, and work experience
* Approximately 8 to 15 years of application development experience
* Proficiency in Java (JDK 1\\.8/1\\.7\\), JEE, XML, XSD, and Maven
* Payment expertise, such as SEPA or/and SCT Instant Payments, is an asset
* Experience with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins, as well as unit tests, out\\-of\\-container tests, integration tests, and selenium\\-based tests
* Knowledge of WebSphere
* Familiarity with Oracle databases
* Knowledge of WebLogic or JBoss is an asset
* Good problem\\-solving, teamwork, and time management skills
* Strong communication skills in English


**What You Will Be Doing**
* Analyze and translate business requirements into product designs
* Create and modify program logic for new applications
* Code, test, debug, and document software applications
* Ensure successful implementation of system improvements
* Write technical specifications and other forms of documentation
* Provide leadership and/or guidance to other technical professionals when needed


**What We Offer You**
* An exciting opportunity be a part of World‚Äôs Leading FinTech Product MNC
* To be a part of vibrant team and to build up a career in core banking/payments domain
* Competitive salary and attractive benefits including GHMI/ Hospitalization coverage for employee and direct dependents
* A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities


**Privacy Statement**
 FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
   

  

**Sourcing Model**
 Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

title: Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 1 May 2025
   

  

**Title**
 Data Engineer
   

  

**Job Description**
 A Data Engineer is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining large\\-scale data systems and infrastructure. Their primary goal is to ensure that data is properly collected, stored, processed, and retrieved to support business intelligence, analytics, and data\\-driven decision\\-making.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design and Develop Data Pipelines: Create data pipelines to extract data from various sources, transform it into a standardized format, and load it into a centralized data repository.
* Build and Maintain Data Infrastructure: Design, implement, and manage data warehouses, data lakes, and other data storage solutions.
* Ensure Data Quality and Integrity: Develop data validation, cleansing, and normalization processes to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
* Collaborate with Data Analysts and Business Process Owners: Work with data analysts and business process owners to understand their data requirements and provide data support for their projects.
* Optimize Data Systems for Performance: Continuously monitor and optimize data systems for performance, scalability, and reliability.
* Develop and Maintain Data Governance Policies: Create and enforce data governance policies to ensure data security, compliance, and regulatory requirements.


**Experience \\& Skills**
* Hands\\-on experience in implementing, supporting, and administering modern cloud\\-based data solutions (Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, Snowflake, etc.).
* Strong programming skills in SQL, Java, and Python.
* Experience in configuring and managing data pipelines using Apache Airflow, Informatica, Talend, SAP BODS or API\\-based extraction.
* Expertise in real\\-time data processing frameworks.
* Strong understanding of Git and CI/CD for automated deployment and version control.
* Experience with Infrastructure\\-as\\-Code tools like Terraform for cloud resource management.
* Good stakeholder management skills to collaborate effectively across teams.
* Solid understanding of SAP ERP data and processes to integrate enterprise data sources.
* Exposure to data visualization and front\\-end tools (Tableau, Looker, etc.).
* Strong command of English with excellent communication skills.

title: Senior .Net Developer  with Cloud
description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer to support a large\\-scale modernization initiative, migrating multiple legacy components to Azure. The role involves delivering highly complex cloud modernization solutions within a FinTech environment, working closely with a cross\\-functional team to design, build, and optimize cloud\\-native systems. This project is part of a broader transformation roadmap with significant future growth and long\\-term impact.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Lead and contribute to the modernization and migration of legacy applications to Azure.
* Design, develop, and deploy cloud\\-native solutions using Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
* Work with distributed messaging systems such as RabbitMQ and Azure Service Bus.
* Build and maintain services using .NET Framework and .NET Core.
* Design and optimize data access using Azure SQL Database.
* Collaborate with Tech Lead, developers, and QA to ensure high\\-quality delivery.
* Participate in architectural discussions, code reviews, and performance optimization.
* Ensure solutions meet security, scalability, and reliability requirements typical of FinTech systems.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience with Azure cloud services, particularly AKS.
* Hands\\-on expertise with .NET Framework and .NET Core.
* Solid experience with messaging systems (RabbitMQ and/or Azure Service Bus).
* Experience working with Azure SQL Database.
* Proven background in complex system modernization or cloud migration projects.
* Ability to work effectively in a team\\-based, agile development environment.


**Nice to have**
* Experience in the FinTech or financial services domain.
* Prior involvement in large\\-scale modernization programs (multiple components or platforms).
* Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure\\-as\\-code in Azure.
* Experience working in regulated or high\\-availability environments.
* Interest in long\\-term projects with opportunities to modernize additional components.


**We offer**
* Opportunity to work on bleeding\\-edge projects
* Work with a highly motivated and dedicated team
* Competitive salary
* Flexible schedule
* Benefits package \\- medical insurance, sports

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large\\-scale, distributed, fault\\-tolerant systems enabling online ordering for thousands of restaurants across multiple brands. SRE ensures that Inspire Digital Platform (IDP) services have reliability, uptime appropriate to users' needs and a fast rate of improvement. Additionally, SRE‚Äôs will keep an ever\\-watchful eye on our systems capacity and performance perform regular capacity planning exercise. Much of our software development focuses on optimizing existing systems, building infrastructure and eliminating work through automation.
   

  

****Responsibilities****
 Review current workload patterns, understand the business case and prioritize areas of weakness within the platform through log and metric investigation as well as application profiling.
   

  

* Work with senior engineering and testing team members to build tools and recommend testing strategies for problem prevention, detection.
* Employ deep troubleshooting skills to improve the availability, performance, and security to ensure services are designed with 24/7 availability and operational readiness and rigor.
* Perform in depth postmortem on production incidents, to assess effective business impact and for Engineering to learn from these.
* Create Dashboards and alerts for Monitoring the IDP platform, define key metrics and service level indicators and ensure relevant metric data is collected to create actionable alerts for SRE and Network Operation Center.
* Participate in the 24/7 on call rotation.
* Automate toil, by building software and automation for seamless application deployment and third\\-party tool integration.
* Ensure the platform holds a high degree of reliability, at least three 9s.
* Define non\\-functional requirements as part of the product lifecycle to influence the new designs, standards, and methods for scalable, highly available distributed systems
* own technically intricate issues that cross between DevOps, Databases, Networking, Code, Infrastructure and people; drive them to satisfactory completion.
* Provide recommendations and feedback in design reviews and review sessions.


****Requirements****
 AKS, API management, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Blob Storage, Cosmo DB, Service Bus, Azure Functions, New Relic, Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana., Java, TypeScript, python.
   

  

**Nice to have**
****Requirements:****
* Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science, a related field, or equivalent practical experience
* Minimum 5 years of experience as a Software Engineer, Platform, SRE or Devops engineer supporting large scale SAAS Production B2C or B2B Cloud Platforms.
* Development skills, Java, TypeScript, python, OOP expertise is a must.
* Hands on Azure Cloud experience particularly with AKS, API management, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Blob Storage, Cosmo DB, Service Bus, Azure Functions.
* Proficiency in monitoring, APM and profiling tools, New Relic, Splunk, Prometheus, Grafana.
* Working experience with containers, Kubernetes and Helm.
* Functional knowledge of Cloud Network, Firewalls, Ingress and Egress controllers, Service Mesh and
* experience with Auth0 Secret management and Cloudflare, CDN, Load Balancer, Cache, Firewall, worker features.
* Experience with ArgoCD, GitLab, CICD, Terraform , Infrastructure as Code.
* Strong communication skills and ability to explain technical concepts clearly and simply
* A willingness to dive into understanding, debugging, and improving any layer of the stack
